trans-unit.source: Represents the contents of the wst:UseKey element.
This optional element enables the client to request the identity provider to issue a token containing its public key which is specified under the wst:UseKey element.
However, the client has to prove possession of the key.
In a WS-Security-based SOAP message, the client can add its certificate as an endorsing token to the Security header to prove possession of the key.
For more information about the element that this class represents, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey"></xref> class.
The constructor for extensibility.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey"></xref> class using the specified security key identifier.
Use this constructor if the requestor knows how to convert the token to a security key identifier or if the token is already a security key identifier.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey.Token%2A> property is set to `null` in the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey> instance.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that represents the existing key that should be used.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey"></xref> class using the specified security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey.SecurityKeyIdentifier%2A> property is set to `null` in the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey> instance.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the existing key that should be used.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey"></xref> class using the specified security key identifier and security token.
Use this constructor to pass more information to the security token service (STS) from the serializer.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that represents the existing key that should be used.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the existing key that should be used.
Gets the security key identifier
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that represents the security key identifier.
Gets the security token if the serializer cannot convert it to the security key identifier.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the token.
